Docs.summary: This object, member, or enumeration is deprecated and is not intended to be used in your code.A collection of the objects in the current shared workspace.

remarks.para: Use the property of the object to return a SharedWorkspaceFiles collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Core.SharedWorkspaceFile Add (string FileName, object ParentFolder, object OverwriteIfFileAlreadyExists, object KeepInSync);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Core.SharedWorkspaceFile Add([in]string FileName, [in]object ParentFolder, [in]object OverwriteIfFileAlreadyExists, [in]object KeepInSync) runtime managed
Public Function Add (FileName As String, Optional ParentFolder As Object, Optional OverwriteIfFileAlreadyExists As Object, Optional KeepInSync As Object) As SharedWorkspaceFile

Docs.param: Required String. The path and filename of the file to be added to the current shared workspace.

Optional . The subfolder in which to place the file, if not the main document library folder within the shared workspace. Add the file to the main document library folder by leaving this optional argument empty.
Optional Boolean. True to overwrite an existing file by the same name. Default is False.
Optional Boolean. True to keep the local copy of the document synchronized with the copy in the shared workspace. Default is False.
Docs.summary: Adds a file to the document library in a shared workspace.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns 1297307460, which represents the string MSWD; if created in Microsoft Excel, this property returns 1480803660. This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode in Word, or xlCreatorCode in Excel.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

The Creator property always returns the numeric identifier for the active application, just as the property always returns the name of the active application in string form. Use the CreatedBy property of the , , , and objects to return the name of the individual who created those objects. Use document properties to return information about the authors of Office documents.

Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(Index As Integer) As SharedWorkspaceFile

Docs.param: Optional Integer. Returns the SharedWorkspaceFile at the position specified. does not correspond to the order in which the items are displayed in the Shared Workspace pane, and is not affected by re-sorting the display.
Docs.summary: Returns a object from the Files collection of the shared workspace.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ItemCountExceeded As Boolean
public: property bool ItemCountExceeded { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the number of items in the collection has exceeded the 99 that can be displayed in the Shared Workspace task pane.

remarks.para: The Shared Workspace task pane can only display 99 shared workspace files and folders, links, members, or tasks. If more than 99 items are added to any of these collections, the following occurs:

item.para: The corresponding tab of the Shared Workspace task pane will stop displaying the list of items and will display a link to the shared workspace site Web page instead.
The collection will no longer be populated locally, and its property will return 0 (zero).

remarks.para: Furthermore, once the ItemCountExceeded property returns True for the specified collection, the developer can no longer remedy the situation programmatically by deleting items from the collection to reduce the count below 99, because the collection is no longer populated.

The ItemCountExceeded property of the SharedWorkspaceFiles and the collections returns True when the combined count of files and folders exceeds 99, because both lists are combined and displayed together on the Documents tab of the Shared Workspace task pane.
